name: UpdateArticleDetails
description:
Update details of a specific article on Intercom.

This tool updates the details of a specific article on Intercom. It should be called when you need to modify an existing article's information.

parameters.name: article_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the article on Intercom.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier for the article which is given by Intercom.

parameters.name: intercom_api_version
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the Intercom API to use for the update. Choose from: 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, 2.8, 2.9.

parameters.name: article_update_details
parameters.description: A JSON object containing details of the article update like title, description, body, author_id, state, and translations. The keys include title, description, body, author_id (as an integer), state (either 'published' or 'draft'), and translated_content (a JSON object with locales as keys). These details are critical for updating the article's content and metadata.

title.description: The title of the article.For multilingual articles, this will be the title of the default language's content.

description.description: The description of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the description of the default language's content.

body.description: The content of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the body of the default language's content.

author_id.description: The id of the author of the article. For multilingual articles, this will be the id of the author of the default language's content. Must be a teammate on the help center's workspace.

state.description: Whether the article will be `published` or will be a `draft`. Defaults to draft. For multilingual articles, this will be the state of the default language's content.

parent_id.description: The id of the article's parent collection or section. An article without this field stands alone.

parent_type.description: The type of parent, which can either be a `collection` or `section`.

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the article.

state.description: Whether the article is `published` or is a `draft` .

created_at.description: The time when the article was created (seconds).

updated_at.description: The time when the article was last updated (seconds).

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the article.
